CODIF_DATA.AA_AUTHORITY_TYPE: Ministry or any other national or federal authority
CODIF_DATA.PR_PROC: Negotiated without a prior call for competition

ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: Ministry of Defence, Air Support, C17 Command Support and Airborne Equipment Project Team (CSAE PT)

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: Ministry of Defence, Air Support, C17 Command Support and Airborne Equipment Project Team (CSAE PT)

SHORT_DESCR.P: Provision of spares, repairs and maintenance support and Post Design Services (PDS) for Oxygen Regulators and Aircraft Modular Oxygen Systems (AMOS) required for high altitude parachuting.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: The Secretary of State for Defence (the Authority) intends to award an extension to Contract HTPT2B/1119 with Meggitt Avionics Limited from the 1 April to 31 December 2020 for the ongoing provision of spares, repairs and maintenance support and Post Design Services (PDS) for Oxygen Regulators and Aircraft Modular Oxygen Systems (AMOS) required for high altitude parachuting. These were originally manufactured by (or companies that are now part of) Meggitt Avionics Ltd. It is also intended to increase the value of the contract by GBP 930 000.

It is considered that this contract can be placed using the negotiated procedure without prior publication of a contract notice pursuant to Article 28(1)(e) of Directive 2009/81/EC (Regulation 16(1)(a)(ii) of the Defence and Security Public Contracts Regulations 2011). This is due to technical reasons which would make it extremely difficult, time consuming and costly for any other economic operator to undertake aspects of the work required within this proposed contract extension period.

The need to obtain the necessary licenses, tools, test equipment and develop technical expertise to undertake PDS activities, manufacture spares and undertake repairs/maintenance for platforms nearing their out of service date would not be viable without engaging with Meggitt Avionics Ltd for a significant proportion of the work.

In addition, the selection of any other economic operator who are not the component design organisation and do not have the knowledge and in-use reliability data to conduct fault and safety investigations could result in the loss of the air system capability as the authority would not be able to fulfil its safety requirements to ensure the safe functioning of the affected air platforms.

Any proposed new equipment to replace that produced by Meggitt Avionics Ltd would have to be trialed and approved by a variety of Type Airworthiness Authorities which would not occur within the proposed contract extension period, if at all.
As a result, Meggitt Avionics Ltd is considered the only company able to fulfil the full requirement.

ADDRESS_CONTRACTOR.ADDRESS: Units 2-5 Titchfield Park, 20-26 Barnes Wallis Road, Fareham

INFO_ADD.P: The authority reserves the right to amend any condition related to security of information to reflect any changes in national law or government policy. If any contract documents are accompanied by instructions on safeguarding classified information (e.g. a Security Aspects Letter), the authority reserves the right to amend the terms of these instructions to reflect any changes in national law or government policy, whether in respect of the applicable protective marking scheme, specific protective markings given, the aspects to which any protective marking applies, or otherwise. The link below to the Gov.uk website provides information on the Government Security Classification.

Advertising Regime OJEU: this contract opportunity is published in the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU), the MoD Defence Contracts Bulletin and www.contracts.mod.uk GO Reference: GO-2020319-DCB-16207688
